result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Jay Fetzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  I will complete 40 hours of community service through the Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC within the first six months of this agreement.
B.  I will not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
C.  I will pay in full any/all costs for my court appointed attorney.

supervisions.notes: 5 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing 10-16-2015 @ 9:00 p.m. with credit for 2 days served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Jay Fetzer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Refund balance of bond posted after applying to costs/surcharges.
From bond.

Defendant Andrew Jay Fetzer in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears w/o counsel.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney, didn't qualify for PD, court could appointed county appt'd attorney.  Defendant waives right to atty, files waiver form with the court.   Court revokes DPA, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of possession of THC.  DA stated his recommendation was 5 days jail or probation.  Defendant would like the 5 days jail.  Court sentenced defendant to 5 days in PCJ with credit for 2 days.  Jail sent. to com. 10/16 @ 9:00 p.m.; impose fine/costs $443.  TTP $100/mo. com. 11/1.  Advised of appeal rights.  Court approves right to ask to expunge case 1 year from today, you must write me a letter.

Defendant Andrew Jay Fetzer in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing on Motion to Revoke DPA on 7/13/15, defendant f/t/a, warrant was issued.  Court advises defendant of right to attorney.  State requests $500 Signature Bond.  Court inquires why State requesting signature bond and orders $500 cash bond; informs defendant to contact PD office and set this matter for tom. at 2:30 p.m.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew Jay Fetzer not in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Revoke DPA filed by the State for failure to comply with community service program.  Court confirms defendant failed to complete C/S as part of the DPA, was revoked from the C/S program.  Notice of this hearing mailed to defendant on 6/25/15.  Court notes defendant has failed to pay other court ordered obligations.  Court grants motion to revoke, accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.  Warrant authorized.
Motion hearing at 07-13-2015 11:00 am
Motion to Revoke Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement.

Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S.  Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S for failure to comply with the program.  The defendant has not completed the assigned community service.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement.
Status conference at 06-22-2015 01:00 pm
Petition for Payment of County Appointed Attorney Fees

Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Atty.  Ordered that $186.40 be allowed to said atty as compensation of his professional service and disbursements, said sums to be paid to said Atty. by Pepin County and Pepin County shall be reimbursed by defendant as previously ordered, with the defendant being credited for any sums already paid to the Pepin County Clerk of Court as part of his court-ordered attorney obligations.

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 40 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 05-05-2015. Complete all hours by 10-01-2015 with minimum of 8 hours per month.   Consequences of termination from the program:  Revoke DPA.

Judge advises defendant of charge/penalties in 15TR52, defendant pleads guilty.  Court advisees defendant of charge/max penalties in 15CM16.  Defendant enters plea of guilty.   Court reviews PLQ/WOR form.   Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, defers acceptance of plea in 15CM16 and approves DPA.  DA to file.  In 15TR52, court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty, assess forfeiture $887.50 to be paid $100/mo. com. 6/1/15.  Complete TTP; AODA/DSP; revoke D/L 6 mos. retroactive to any administrative suspension.  On the DPA, complete 40 hrs. c/s, see CJCC coordinator today.  Court informs the DA to add to the DPA a condition of paying county appointed attorney fees as previously ordered.  $100/mo. payments to be applied to attorney fees first, then fine.  Dismiss other citation.

Defendant Andrew Jay Fetzer in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs court of plea negotiations. Defendant will plead to 15TR52 and 15CM16 as DAGPA.
Letter to Atty Bachman regarding his client has not made his county appointed attorney payment.  cc:  Andrew Fetzer.

Ordered that Attorney John Bachman is appointed to represent the defendant as defense counsel.
Further Ordered That the defendant shall reimburse the County by monthly installments of $100.00 per month commencing 04-01-2015, subsequent payments due the same day of each and every month thereafter.
Failure to make scheduled payments without a showing by the defendant of good cause shall be contempt of court punishable under Ch. 785, Wis. Stats. and the Court shall do any of the following:  See Order

Defendant Andrew Jay Fetzer in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charge/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant didn't qualify for SPD, requests County Appt'd Atty.  Court appoints Atty John Bachman who accepts.  Defendant to reimburse Pepin Co. at rate of $100/mo. com. 4/1/15.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance at 03-17-2015 01:30 pm
